fields.label: Is the address conspicuous?
fields.name: is_the_address_conspicuous
fields.instructions: Fire Code 505.1 Address numbers. Buildings and structures shall have their lawful address numbers, building numbers and/or other approved building identification placed at a location on or near a building that allows such building identification to be plainly discernible from the public street or frontage space. These numbers shall contrast with their background. Address numbers shall be arabic numerals or alphabet letters. Numbers shall be a minimum of 4 inches (102 mm) high with a minimum stroke width of 1/2 inch (12.7 mm). Address numbers shall additionally comply with the requirements of the Building Code, New York City Housing Maintenance Code and the borough president of the borough in which such building is located.

fields.label: Is exterior clear of rubbish?
fields.name: is_exterior_clear_of_rubbish
fields.instructions: Fire Code 505.1 Address numbers. Numbers shall be a minimum of 4 inches (102 mm) high with a minimum stroke width of 1/2 inch (12.7 mm). Obstructions. Posts, fences, vegetation, rubbish containers, vehicles and other items shall not be installed, planted, placed, parked or stored near fire hydrants, fire department inlet connections or fire protection system control valves in a manner that would obscure the location of such fire hydrants, connections or valves, or that would hinder immediate access thereto by firefighting personnel.If there is no siamese connection, select n/a

fields.label: Is the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide correct?

fields.instructions:
If the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide was prepared by NY Fire Consultants, do not answer no. Correct information and email to office.

If it was prepared by another company and is incorrect, answer No

fields.label: Is Part I- Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide posted?
fields.name: is_part_i-_building_information_section_of_the_fire_emergency_preparedness_guide_posted
fields.instructions: Part I- Building Information Section of the Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide shall be posted in a conspicuous area near any common mailbox area customarily used by the occupants of the building, or if there is no common mailbox area, in a conspicuous location in or near the elevators or main stairwell.

fields.label: Are Fire Safety Notices posted?
fields.name: are_fire_safety_notices_posted
fields.instructions: Fire Safety Notice shall be posted in a conspicuous area near any common mailbox area customarily used by the occupants of the building, or if there is no common mailbox area, in a conspicuous location in or near the elevators or main stairwell.

fields.label: Is Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide and Notice laminated or framed?
fields.name: is_fire_emergency_preparedness_guide_and_notice_laminated_or_framed
fields.instructions: Fire Emergency Preparedness Guide and Notices must be displayed in a frame under a clear plexiglas cover or laminated with a firm backing and designed to be affixed by mounting hardware or an adhesive, or printed on a matte-finish vinyl adhesive-backed decal not less than three (3) mils in thickness, using thermalprinting, screenprinting or other permanent, water-resistant printing technique.

fields.label: Did the building keep records of checking for the Fire Safety Notice posted on the inside of the apartment's main entrance doors?
fields.name: did_the_building_keep_records_of_checking_for_the_fire_safety_notice_posted_on_the_inside_of_the_apartments_main_entrance_doors
fields.instructions: Location. A fire and emergency preparedness notice shall be posted in each of the following locations: (1) Dwelling unit door. On the inside surface of the front or main entrance door of each dwelling unit in the building. (2) Common area. In a conspicuous location near any common mailbox area customarily used by building occupants, or if there is no common mailbox area, in a conspicuous location in or near the elevators or main stairwell.

Buildings 100 ft. or less must comply with the 2014 FC 504.4 (Rooftop Access and Obstructions)

Use the link below to view the 2014 Fire Codes

fields.label: Is there unobstructed roof access for Fire Department operations?

fields.instructions: Access to building rooftops shall be provided for fire operations by providing unobstructed access to the rooftop, including unobstructed passage across the building parapet, perimeter fence or other obstructions, and a safe landing. Such rooftop access shall be provided in compliance with FC504.4.1

fields.label: Are any stairways in the building enclosed stairs?
fields.name: are_any_stairways_in_the_building_enclosed_stairs
fields.instructions: If any stairwell in the building is an enclosed stairway, select yes

fields.label: Are all enclosed stairway doors self-closing?
fields.name: are_all_enclosed_stairway_doors_self-closing
fields.instructions: § 28-315.10 Self-closing doors. All doors providing access to interior corridors or stairs (Apartment and Stairway doors) in occupancy groups R-1 (Apartment Houses) and R-2 (Hotels) shall be self-closing or equipped with a device that will ensure closing

fields.label: Describe what floors and stairway self-closing doors do not operate on?
fields.name: describe_what_floors_and_stairway_self-closing_doors_do_not_operate_on

fields.label: Do all enclosed stairway door latches catch?
fields.name: do_all_enclosed_stairway_door_latches_catch
fields.instructions:
Stairwell doors leading to public hallways must be fire proof self closing with door knobs on the public hallway occupancy side and a latch that holds the door in the closed position until the door knob is turned. (Doorknobs are not required on the stairwell side)

These regulations do not apply to doors from stairwells that lead directly into apartments.

fields.label: Describe what floors and stairway door latches do not operate?
fields.name: describe_what_floors_and_stairway_door_latches_do_not_operate

fields.label: Do all enclosed stairway doors have knobs on the hallway side of the door?
fields.name: do_all_enclosed_stairway_doors_have_knobs_on_the_hallway_side_of_the_door
fields.instructions:
Stairwell doors leading to public hallways must be fire proof self closing with door knobs on the public hallway occupancy side and a latch that holds the door in the closed position until the door knob is turned. (Doorknobs are not required on the stairwell side)

These regulations do not apply to doors from stairwells that lead directly into apartments.

fields.label: Describe what floors and stairways do not have door knobs on the public hallway side.
fields.name: describe_what_floors_and_stairways_do_not_have_door_knobs_on_the_public_hallway_side

fields.label: Is there a "Close the Door Notice" sign on the public hallway side of the stairway exit doors?
fields.name: is_there_a_close_the_door_notice_sign_on_the_public_hallway_side_of_the_stairway_exit_doors
fields.instructions:
The Close the Door notice shall be posted and maintained on the public hallway corridor side of each stairwell door. The intent is to provide a clear, visible reminder to building residents of the importance of closing each door as one exits one’s apartment and building during a fire.

No sign is required for an open stair.
Select n/a if there are open stairs.

fields.label: Indicate those floors where "Close the Door Notice" signs are missing?
fields.name: indicate_those_floors_where_close_the_door_notice_signs_are_missing
fields.instructions: Enter the floor # and stairwell designation where Close the Door Notice signs are missing.

fields.label: Are the appropriate Fire Emergency markings present on all enclosed stairwell door jambs?
fields.name: are_the_appropriate_fire_emergency_markings_present_on_all_enclosed_stairwell_door_jambs
fields.instructions:
As of March 30, 2018 each stairwell door shall be identified by an approved Fire Emergency sign or marking on the door jamb of public corridor side of the door.

Such sign or marking must be not more than 12 inches from the bottom of the door.

Fire Emergency markings are not required in fully sprinklered buildings.

fields.label: Describe what floors and stairway doors do not have Fire Emergency markings on the public hallway side.
fields.name: describe_what_floors_and_stairway_doors_do_not_have_fire_emergency_markings_on_the_public_hallway_side

fields.label: Is there storage in stairs or hallways?
fields.name: is_there_storage_in_stairs_or_hallways
fields.instructions:
Fire Code 1027.2
It shall be unlawful to obstruct or impede access to any required means of egress, including any exit, exit access or exit discharge.

The New York City Fire Department is strenuously enforcing the law that forbids storage of any garbage, garbage receptacles, newspapers, cardboard boxes or any other items including furniture in stairways and on stairway landings.

fields.label: Describe what floors, stairway letters or which hallways where there is storage?
fields.name: describe_what_floors_stairway_letters_or_which_hallways_where_there_is_storage

fields.label: Are all hallways and stairs free of rubbish?
fields.name: are_all_hallways_and_stairs_free_of_rubbish
fields.instructions:
Fire Code 1027.2
It shall be unlawful to obstruct or impede access to any required means of egress, including any exit, exit access or exit discharge.

fields.label: Describe what and where rubbish is found in the hallways and stairs?
fields.name: describe_what_and_where_rubbish_is_found_in_the_hallways_and_stairs

fields.label: If there are scissor stairs, are they lettered correctly?
fields.name: if_there_are_scissor_stairs_are_they_lettered_correctly

fields.label: Are all stairs lettered correctly and on both sides of stairs?
fields.name: are_all_stairs_lettered_correctly_and_on_both_sides_of_stairs
fields.instructions: An alphabetic letter shall identify each stairway. The stair identification signs should be at least 3" high and shall be posted and maintained on both sides of the door leading to the stairway, on every floor, including the ground floor. If there is no door, the signs must be posted in a conspicuous place on the nearby wall or adjacent wall.

fields.label: Are all floors numbered correctly and on both sides of stairs?
fields.name: are_all_floors_numbered_correctly_and_on_both_sides_of_stairs
fields.instructions: A number shall identify each floor. The signs should be at least 3" high and shall be posted and maintained on both sides of the door leading to the stairway, on every floor, including the ground floor. If there is no door, the signs must be posted in a conspicuous place on the nearby wall or adjacent wall.

fields.label: Are all Apartments numbered?
fields.name: are_all_apartments_numbered
fields.instructions: As of March 30, 2017, each dwelling unit shall be identified on the public corridor side of the door by a room number and/or letter marking or sign conspicuously and durably printed or posted on or adjacent to at least one entrance door.

fields.label: Are there more than 8 apartments on any floor?
fields.name: are_there_more_than_8_apartments_on_any_floor
fields.instructions:
Select YES if any floor has OVER 8 apartments.

Non fully-sprinklered buildings with more than 8 apartments on a floor must comply with additional signage rules.

fields.label: Are there directional arrows for apartments in the elevator lobbies for each floor with more than 8 apartments?
fields.name: are_there_directional_arrows_for_apartments_in_the_elevator_lobbies_for_each_floor_with_more_than_8_apartments
fields.instructions:
As of March 30, 2017, in apartment buildings with more than 8 dwelling units on a floor, a sign shall be conspicuously posted in the elevator lobby on those floors identifying by directional arrows and dwelling unit numbers and/or letters, the direction of each unit.

If dwelling units are all in one direction, no sign is needed. Select n/a

fields.label: Are the Fire Emergency Markings present on each apartment door jamb?
fields.name: are_the_fire_emergency_markings_present_on_each_apartment_door_jamb
fields.instructions:
Each dwelling unit shall be identified on the door jamb by an approved fire emergency marking, not more than 12 inches from the bottom of the door indicating the dwelling unit number and/or letter.

Fire Emergency markings are not required in fully sprinklered buildings

fields.label: Indicate those apartments where emergency markings are missing
fields.name: indicate_those_apartments_where_emergency_markings_are_missing

fields.label: Are there any multi-floor apartments in this building?
fields.name: are_there_any_multi-floor_apartments_in_this_building
fields.instructions: Such as duplex or triplex apartments.

fields.label: Is the appropriate Fire Emergency Markings present on each multi-floor apartment door jamb?
fields.name: is_the_appropriate_fire_emergency_markings_present_on_each_multi-floor_apartment_door_jamb
fields.instructions:
As of March 30, 2017, the entrance door to a multi-floor dwelling shall be identified on the door jamb by an approved fire emergency marking, not more than 12 inches from the bottom of the door indicating the dwelling unit number and/or letter.

In addition, every door of the multi-floor dwelling that opens to a public corridor shall be identified by one or more upward or downward pointing arrows indicating the direction(s) of the other floor(s) to which the multi-floor dwelling is connected.

A star symbol identifies the main entrance door.
A triangle symbol identifies a secondary entrance.

fields.label: List multiple floor apartments that are missing emergency markings
fields.name: list_multiple_floor_apartments_that_are_missing_emergency_markings

fields.label: Do apartment entrance doors have "peepholes"?
fields.name: do_apartment_entrance_doors_have_peepholes
fields.instructions:
Housing Maintenance Code Sec. D26-20.01 Peepholes: In every dwelling the owner shall provide and maintain a peephole in the entrance door of each dwelling unit. Such peephole shall be located, as prescribed by the department, in such a place that the person in each dwelling unit may view from the inside any person immediately outside the entrance door. However, such peephole need not be installed in any tenant-occupied one- or two-family home where it is possible to see from the inside any person immediately outside the entrance door. This section shall not apply to hotels, apartment hotels, college or school dormitories, or owner-occupied dwelling units in one- and two-family homes.

Select n/a if peephole is not required.

fields.label: Indicate those apartment/s where required peepholes are missing?
fields.name: indicate_those_apartments_where_required_peepholes_are_missing

fields.label: Do all electrical outlets in public areas have protective covers installed?
fields.name: do_all_electrical_outlets_in_public_areas_have_protective_covers_installed
fields.instructions: Local Law 39 of 2015 mandates that the owners of Multiple Dwellings must install protective covers over all outlets located in public areas of the building. Only mechanical rooms, storage rooms and the apartments themselves are exempt from this requirement. (such devices shall not be required for electrical outlets that are listed tamper-resistant receptacles in accordance with the New York city electrical code). If there are no electrical outlets in the hallways choose N/A

fields.label: Indicate those public areas where protective electrical cover are not installed.

fields.label: Is there a screen under the bulkhead skylight?
fields.name: is_there_a_screen_under_the_bulkhead_skylight
fields.instructions: If there is no bulkhead skylight, select n/a

fields.label: Are there any holes in fire protected walls or ceilings which are not properly Fire Stopped?
fields.name: are_there_any_holes_in_fire_protected_walls_or_ceilings_which_are_not_properly_fire_stopped
fields.instructions:
All penetrations must be sealed to achieve original fire rating or better.
FIRE-RESISTANCE-RATED CONSTRUCTION 703.1 Maintenance: The required fire-resistance rating of fire-resistance-rated construction (including walls, fire stops, shaft enclosures, partitions and floors) shall be maintained. Such elements shall be properly repaired, restored or replaced when damaged, altered, breached or penetrated. Openings made therein for the passage of pipes, electrical conduit, wires, ducts, air transfer openings, and holes made for any reason shall be protected with approved methods capable of resisting the passage of smoke and fire. Openings through fire-resistance-rated assemblies shall be protected by self-closing or automatic-closing doors of approved construction meeting the fire protection requirements for the assembly.

fields.label: Is there a diagram on the service elevator sign?
fields.name: is_there_a_diagram_on_the_service_elevator_sign
fields.instructions: On all floors other than the main entrance floor, a sign shall be posted and maintained on every floor at the elevator landing. The sign shall read "IN CASE OF FIRE, USE STAIRS UNLESS OTHERWISE INSTRUCTED". The sign shall contain a floor diagram showing the location where it is posted and the location and letter identification of the stairs on the floor and each elevator bank.

fields.name: are_cellar_stairs_equipped_with_properly_operating_fireproof_self-closing_doors

fields.label: Is the cellar free of substandard/improper/exposed wiring?
fields.name: is_the_cellar_free_of_substandardimproperexposed_wiring
fields.instructions: Select no if there is any exposed wiring, or electrical boxes missing covers. FC 605.6 Unapproved conditions. Open junction boxes and open-wiring splices shall be prohibited. Approved covers shall be provided for all switch and electrical outlet boxes.

fields.label: Good housekeeping in cellar?
fields.name: good_housekeeping_in_cellar

fields.label: Are electrical extension cords being used in place of permanent wiring?
fields.name: are_electrical_extension_cords_being_used_in_place_of_permanent_wiring
fields.instructions: Although this condition will most commonly be found in the basement, select yes if this is found anywhere in the building Fire Code 605.5 Extension cords: Extension cords and flexible cords shall not be a substitute for permanent wiring. Extension cords and flexible cords shall not be affixed to buildings or structures, extended through walls, ceilings or floors, or under doors or floor coverings, nor shall such cords be subject to environmental damage or physical impact. Extension cords shall be used only with portable devices.

fields.label: Indicate those areas where temporary wiring (extension cords) are being used in place of permanent wiring?
fields.name: indicate_those_areas_where_temporary_wiring_extension_cords_are_being_used_in_place_of_permanent_wiring
fields.instructions: Indicate those areas <u>anywhere</u> in the building where illegal temporary wiring is found; not just in the basement.

fields.label: Is portable gasoline equipment stored in the building?
fields.name: is_portable_gasoline_equipment_stored_in_the_building
fields.instructions: This includes lawn-care equipment, power washers, snow blowers, portable generators and other portable fueled equipment designed for outdoor use

fields.label: If gasoline is being stored, is it properly stored?
fields.name: if_gasoline_is_being_stored_is_it_properly_stored
fields.instructions: Select n/a if gasoline in not being stored. A permit is required if the total amount of gasoline stored is more than two and one half (2 1/2) gallons. Gasoline must be stored in an approved container. The maximum capacity of any gasoline container is two and one-half (2-1/2) gallons. The container must be made of metal and have a safety cap attached. The cap must be fitted with a spout designed to allow the gasoline to be poured without spilling. The contents of the container must be clearly marked on the side of the container. Gasoline can never be stored in glass or plastic containers.

fields.label: Is there a NO STORAGE PERMITTED sign in the Gas Meter Room?
fields.name: is_there_a_no_storage_permitted_sign_in_the_gas_meter_room
fields.instructions: The sign should read GAS METER ROOM - NO STORAGE PERMITTED. The lettering must be at least one inch high in bold type and properly spaced to provide good legibility. The lettering and background must be of contrasting colors. The sign must be permanently and conspicuously posted on the exterior of the meter room door.

The lettering must be at least one inch high in bold type and properly spaced to provide good legibility. The lettering and background must be of contrasting colors. The sign must be permanently and conspicuously posted on the exterior of the electrical meter room door.

fields.label: Is boiler room equipped with a Fire Extinguisher (Dry Chemical or CO2)?
fields.name: is_boiler_room_equipped_with_a_fire_extinguisher_dry_chemical_or_co2
fields.instructions:
A dry chemical type portable fire extinguisher with at least a 20-B:C rating, or a carbon dioxide type portable fire extinguisher with at least a 2-B:C rating shall be provided.

Such portable fire extinguisher shall be located not more than 30 feet from the fuel oil fired equipment. A travel distance of up to 50 feet may be allowed if a dry chemical portable fire extinguisher with at least a 40-B:C rating, or a carbon dioxide portable fire extinguisher with at least a 4-B:C rating, is provided.

fields.name: indicate_the_location_of_any_sprinkler_heads_which_are_obstructed_with_paintdirt
fields.instructions: Give the floor and location on that floor of any/all obstructed sprinkler heads.

fields.label: Are there signs on the sprinkler system control valves?
fields.name: are_there_signs_on_the_sprinkler_system_control_valves

fields.label: Is a ladder provided if sprinkler valves are over 7ft above floor?
fields.name: is_a_ladder_provided_if_sprinkler_valves_are_over_7ft_above_floor
fields.instructions: A permanently mounted ladder must be provided to access any sprinkler control valves located 7 ft. above the floor. Select n/a if there are no valves above 7 ft.

fields.label: Indicate the location of any sprinkler valves above 7 ft without a ladder being provided
fields.name: indicate_the_location_of_any_sprinkler_valves_above_7_ft_without_a_ladder_being_provided
fields.instructions: Indicate the location of the inaccessible valve.

fields.label: Is FP 100 (Annual / 30 month flow test) current?
fields.name: is_fp_100_annual__30_month_flow_test_current
fields.instructions: Per FC903.5.2.5 - Residential sprinkler systems shall be flow tested annually, except such system may be tested once every 30 months, provided that the pressure gauge located at or near the inspector's test connection is checked during the required monthly inspection to make certain that the system design pressure is being maintained. Such test shall be conducted at the owner's risk by his or her representative, who shall be a licensed Master Plumber or licensed Fire Suppression Contractor. NOTE: This applies to to all residential sprinkler systems, including sprinkler systems that only protect a part of the building or space, such as compactor or laundry room sprinkler systems.

fields.label: Is 5 year FDNY witnessed sprinkler test current? (FP-100 with FDNY witness)
fields.name: is_5_year_fdny_witnessed_sprinkler_test_current_fp-100_with_fdny_witness
fields.instructions:
Per FC903.5.2.5 - A flow test of a sprinkler system shall be witnessed by a representative of the Fire Department at least once every five (5) years. A report of each test, on a form prepared by the department, shall be certified by such plumber or licensed master fire suppression contractor and shall be kept for not less than 5 years and made available for inspection by any representative of the department.

NOTE: This applies to to all residential sprinkler systems, including sprinkler systems that only protect a part of the building or space, such as compactor or laundry room sprinkler systems.

fields.name: does_the_building_have_a_hose_cabinet

fields.label: Is there a sign indicating the location of the hose cabinet?
fields.name: is_there_a_sign_indicating_the_location_of_the_hose_cabinet
fields.instructions: There must be a sign near the first floor standpipe outlet stating where the fire hose cabinet is located. A metal sign shall be placed in each stair enclosure on the main entrance floor stating clearly where the storage cabinet is located.

fields.label: Does Hose Cabinet Lock Box have a sign stating "FOR FD USE ONLY"?
fields.name: does_hose_cabinet_lock_box_have_a_sign_stating_for_fd_use_only
fields.instructions: There must be a sign near the first floor standpipe outlet stating where the fire hose cabinet is located. A metal sign shall be placed in each stair enclosure on the main entrance floor stating clearly where the storage cabinet is located.

fields.label: Does Hose Cabinet have a sign indicating where spare cabinet key is located?
fields.name: does_hose_cabinet_have_a_sign_indicating_where_spare_cabinet_key_is_located
fields.instructions: A sign shall be placed on the Hose storage cabinet indicating the location of the spare key.

fields.label: Does Hose Cabinet lockbox key work?
fields.name: does_hose_cabinet_lockbox_key_work
fields.instructions: The fire hose cabinet must have a lock box with a key for the cabinet within it. If key is inoperable or missing, select no.

fields.label: Does Hose Cabinet have required equipment?
fields.name: does_hose_cabinet_have_required_equipment
fields.instructions: Hose cabinets should contain the following equipment: 375 feet of fire hose, two (2) spanners, three (3) open nozzles and two (2) 2 1/2 to 1 1/2 reducers.

fields.label: List any equipment missing from the Hose Cabinet?
fields.name: list_any_equipment_missing_from_the_hose_cabinet
fields.instructions:
Hose cabinet should contain
1) 375 ft. of fire hose
2) two (2) spanners
3) three (3) open nozzles
4) two (2) 2 1/2 to 1 1/2 reducer

fields.label: What is the year of manufacture of standpipe system hose?

fields.instructions:

If the hose is missing or the the date cannot be determined enter " Date of manufacture could not be determined at time of inspection."

If some or all of the fire hose is over 10 years old, it should be replaced. Manufacturers recommend replacement after 10 years.

fields.name: are_portable_extinguishers_required_or_present_in_this_building
fields.instructions:
Extinguishers are required in:

- Boiler Rooms
- Elevator Machinery Rooms
- Laundry Rooms
- Work Shops
- Compactor Rooms
- Non-Storage Garages.

If this building does not contain any of those rooms/areas, extinguishers are not required.

NOTE: If portable extinguishers are present in areas where they are not required, (E.G. hallways, stairwells, lobbies, etc.) those extinguishers must be inspected and maintained. Answer yes

fields.instructions: Fire pump valves must be electronically monitored by the fire alarm system or be secured open with a chain and lock.

fields.label: If there is a lock on the valve, is there a sign indicating the location of the key?

fields.label: Is the fire pump test being performed and recorded in the logbook?
fields.name: is_the_fire_pump_test_being_performed_and_recorded_in_the_logbook
fields.instructions: A test of fire pump assemblies (weekly for diesel pumps; monthly for electric pumps) shall be conducted without flowing water and shall be conducted by starting the pump automatically. An electric pump shall run a minimum of 10 minutes and diesel pump shall run a minimum of 30 minutes.

fields.label: Is the fire pump test being performed by the MFSPC (or other qualified individuals)?
fields.name: is_the_fire_pump_test_being_performed_by_the_mfspc_or_other_qualified_individuals
fields.instructions: The fire pump test must be performed by an Engineer (Refrigeration Operating Engineer (Q-01 and Q-99), NYC High Pressure Operating Engineer, NYS High Pressure Operating Engineer with S-12 C of F {For employees of a single or multiple properties under common ownership employed by the same building owner/management company}), an MFSPC (Master Fire Suppression Piping Contractor License with S-12 C of F) or MP (Master Plumber License (MP) with S-12 C of F.)

fields.name: does_the_garage_have_extinguishers_or_sand_pails

fields.label: Are the exit signs visible and operational?
fields.name: are_the_exit_signs_visible_and_operational
fields.instructions: NYC Building Code 27-383: The location of every exit on every floor shall be clearly indicated by exit signs. Such signs shall be placed at an angle with the exit opening if such placement is required for the signs to serve their purpose. In long corridors, in open floor areas, and in all other situations where the location of the exit may not be readily visible or understood, directional signs shall be provided to serve as guides from all portions of the corridor or floor.

fields.label: Are there any holes in fire protected walls or ceilings which are not properly Fire Stopped?
fields.name: are_there_any_holes_in_fire_protected_walls_or_ceilings_which_are_not_properly_fire_stopped
fields.instructions:
All penetrations must be sealed to achieve original fire rating or better.
FIRE-RESISTANCE-RATED CONSTRUCTION 703.1 Maintenance: The required fire-resistance rating of fire-resistance-rated construction (including walls, fire stops, shaft enclosures, partitions and floors) shall be maintained. Such elements shall be properly repaired, restored or replaced when damaged, altered, breached or penetrated. Openings made therein for the passage of pipes, electrical conduit, wires, ducts, air transfer openings, and holes made for any reason shall be protected with approved methods capable of resisting the passage of smoke and fire. Openings through fire-resistance-rated assemblies shall be protected by self-closing or automatic-closing doors of approved construction meeting the fire protection requirements for the assembly.

fields.label: Indicate those areas in the garage which are not properly Fire Stopped?
fields.name: indicate_those_areas_in_the_garage_which_are_not_properly_fire_stopped
fields.instructions:
All penetrations must be sealed to achieve original fire rating or better.
FIRE-RESISTANCE-RATED CONSTRUCTION 703.1 Maintenance: The required fire-resistance rating of fire-resistance-rated construction (including walls, fire stops, shaft enclosures, partitions and floors) shall be maintained. Such elements shall be properly repaired, restored or replaced when damaged, altered, breached or penetrated. Openings made therein for the passage of pipes, electrical conduit, wires, ducts, air transfer openings, and holes made for any reason shall be protected with approved methods capable of resisting the passage of smoke and fire. Openings through fire-resistance-rated assemblies shall be protected by self-closing or automatic-closing doors of approved construction meeting the fire protection requirements for the assembly.

fields.label: Is there a notice to occupants regarding SMOKE DETECTORS?
fields.name: is_there_a_notice_to_occupants_regarding_smoke_detectors
fields.instructions:
A notice must be posted in a form approved by the Commissioner of the Department of Housing Preservation and Development in a common area of a Class A multiple dwelling, readily visible and preferably in the area of the inspection certificate.

A Combined Notice for smoke detectors/carbon monoxide detectors and gas leak notice may be used.

fields.label: Is there a notice to occupants regarding CO DETECTORS?
fields.name: is_there_a_notice_to_occupants_regarding_co_detectors
fields.instructions:
A notice must be posted in a form approved by the Commissioner of the Department of Housing Preservation and Development in a common area of a Class A multiple dwelling, readily visible and preferably in the area of the inspection certificate.

A Combined Notice for smoke detectors/carbon monoxide detectors and gas leak notice may be used.

fields.label: Is there a notice to occupants regarding GAS LEAKS?
fields.name: is_there_a_notice_to_occupants_regarding_gas_leaks
fields.instructions:
A notice must be posted in a form approved by the Commissioner of the Department of Housing Preservation and Development in a common area of a Class A multiple dwelling, readily visible and preferably in the area of the inspection certificate.

A Combined Notice for smoke detectors/carbon monoxide detectors and gas leak notice may be used.

fields.label: Is the Super's name and address posted?
fields.name: is_the_supers_name_and_address_posted
fields.instructions: The sign must have the title, name of superintendent, address (including apartment number) and telephone number. The sign must have at least 3/16" lettering and 1/4" border around the lettering. The sign must be made out of metal or plastic unless it is made out of cardboard with a frame with clear glass or plastic cover encasing it.

fields.label: Is there a "NO SMOKING" sign posted in the buildings common area (Lobby)?
fields.name: is_there_a_no_smoking_sign_posted_in_the_buildings_common_area_lobby

fields.label: Is the Certificate of Occupancy posted?
fields.name: is_the_certificate_of_occupancy_posted
fields.instructions: The certificate of occupancy should be placed in a metal or plastic frame that has a transparent covering. The certificate of occupancy must be posted in the building"s main entrance hall or lobby. If the building has a superintendent the certificate of occupancy can be posted in the entrance hall of the resident superintendent's apartment or entrance to the building manager's office.

fields.label: Is the notice to occupants regarding the HOUSING INFORMATION GUIDE posted?
fields.name: is_the_notice_to_occupants_regarding_the_housing_information_guide_posted
fields.instructions: Section 26-1103 requires owners of multiple dwellings to post a notice in a conspicuous place within view of the area in the multiple dwelling to which mail is delivered regarding the availability of a housing information guide for tenants and owners.

fields.label: Does this building need a FD tank permit?
fields.name: does_this_building_need_a_fd_tank_permit

fields.label: Enter the Tank FD permit number and expiration date?
fields.name: enter_the_tank_fd_permit_number_and_expiration_date
fields.instructions:
Enter Tank FD permit # - followed by date in written form (E.G.): 89156896 - January 1, 2014

If the FD permit is missing enter Not available at time of inspection.

If the FD permit is expired enter EXPIRED

fields.label: Does this building need a DOB boiler inspection certificate?
fields.name: does_this_building_need_a_dob_boiler_inspection_certificate
fields.instructions: Boilers in buildings with 6 or more apartments are required to be inspected by a New York State certified inspector once each calendar year.

fields.label: Enter the DOB boiler inspection certificate number and date from the certificate at the building. If the building doesn't have a certificate enter "Certificate not available at the time of inspection"
fields.name: enter_the_dob_boiler_inspection_certificate_number_and_date_from_the_certificate_at_the_building_if_the_building_doesnt_have_a_certificate_enter_certificate_not_available_at_the_time_of_inspection_
fields.instructions:
Enter the DOB boiler certificate # - followed by date in written form (E.G.): C89156896 - January 1, 2014

If the Boiler Inspection Certificate is missing enter
not available at time of inspection.

fields.label: Does this building need a DEP Certificate to Operate?
fields.name: does_this_building_need_a_dep_certificate_to_operate
fields.instructions:
A DEP Certificate to Operate will be required in the following instances:

1) boilers using #4 or #6 fuel 2) A boiler using #2 fuel, Natural Gas, or solid fuel with a maximum input rating equal or greater than 2.8 million BTU/hours.

fields.label: Enter the DEP Certificate to Operate certificate number and expiration date?
fields.name: enter_the_dep_certificate_to_operate_certificate_number_and_expiration_date
fields.instructions:
Enter C of F # - followed by date in written form (E.G.): 89156896 - January 1, 2014

If the DEP Certificate to Operate is missing enter
not available at time of inspection.

If the DEP Certificate to Operate is expired enter EXPIRED

fields.label: Does this building need a Certificate of Fitness for boiler operations?
fields.name: does_this_building_need_a_certificate_of_fitness_for_boiler_operations
fields.instructions:
A P-99 is required if a boiler is not fully automatic or requires preheating of fuel oil (E.G. #6 fuel oil).

A P-98 is required if any fuel oil is transferred by pump from 1 floor to another (E.G. Fuel tank in sub-basement, boiler in basement, or fuel tank in basement and boiler or generator on a higher floor).

fields.label: Enter the Certificate of Fitness number and expiration date?
fields.name: enter_the_certificate_of_fitness_number_and_expiration_date_
fields.instructions:
Enter type of C of F, C of F # - followed by date in written form (E.G.): P-98 #89156896 - January 1, 2014

If the FD C of F is missing enter
not available at time of inspection.

If the FD c of F is expired enterEXPIRED

fields.label: Does this building have an employee with valid a Standipe S-13 or S-14 Cert. of Fitness?
fields.name: does_this_building_have_an_employee_with_valid_a_standipe_s-13_or_s-14_cert_of_fitness
fields.instructions:
S-13 (CityWide Standpipe System)
S-14 (Standpipe for Multi-Zone System)

if this building does not have a standpipe, select n/a

if this building has a standpipe but no C of F holder, or cannot produce the Certificate of Fitness, select no

fields.name: standpipe_c_of_f_number

fields.label: Expiration Date of S-13 or s-14 C of F?
fields.name: expiration_date_of_s-13_or_s-14_c_of_f

fields.label: Does this building have an employee with a valid Sprinkler S-11 or S-12 Cert. of Fitness?
fields.name: does_this_building_have_an_employee_with_a_valid_sprinkler_s-11_or_s-12_cert_of_fitness
fields.instructions:
If there is 1 sprinkler head in the building, an S-11 or S-12 is required
S-11 in lieu of S-12 if building is less than 75 ft tall with less than 36 heads.

if this building does not have a sprinkler system, select n/a

if this building has a sprinkler system but no C of F holder, or cannot produce the Certificate of Fitness, select no .

fields.label: Sprinkler C of F number?
fields.name: sprinkler_c_of_f_number
fields.instructions: Enter whether it is an S-11 or S-12 before the #(E.G: S-12 #8896535)

fields.label: Expiration Date of S-11 or S-12 C of F?
fields.name: expiration_date_of_s-11_or_s-12_c_of_f
fields.instructions: Enter the date in written form (E.G.) January 1, 2014

fields.label: If the building has a fire alarm then the building needs an employee with a current Fire Alarm Certificate of Fitness (S-95). Does a building employee have a current Fire Alarm Certificate of Fitness (S-95)#?
fields.name: does_a_building_employee_have_a_current_fire_alarm_certificate_of_fitness_s-95#
fields.instructions:
If there is an alarm system in the building, a building employee must have a a Certificate of Fitness for Supervision of the Fire Alarm System (S-95)

If there is a building employee with a valid S-95 C of F, select yes

if this building has a Fire Safety Director on duty, select n/a

if this building does not have a S-95 C of F holder (even if they do not have an alarm system), or cannot produce the Certificate of Fitness, select no

fields.label: What is the C of F (S-95) number and expiration date?
fields.name: what_is_the_c_of_f_s-95_number_and_expiration_date
fields.instructions:
A building employee must have a a Certificate of Fitness for Supervision of the Fire Alarm System (S-95).
Enter C of F # - followed by date in written form (E.G.): 89156896 - January 1, 2014
